title: Formative Assessment-Integrated Instructional Design for Learning Complex Mathematical Skills in Vocational Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computation skills and understanding of fundamental work-related mathematical concepts
context.additional_context: An intensive short-term education course designed for learners over 40 in managerial/leadership roles, enabling effective acquisition of complex mathematical skills (e.g., data interpretation, financial calculations) in constrained technology environments (primarily smartphones)

learning_goals: Learners can solve complex workplace mathematical problems (e.g., budget analysis, statistical interpretation) using a four-step problem-solving process.
Learners can self-diagnose their mastery level of mathematical skills into three stages (basic/intermediate/proficient) based on formative assessment feedback.
Learners can achieve over 80% completeness and accuracy in project-based assessment tasks (e.g., department budget planning) by integrating peer evaluation and instructor feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
